channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Here’s why Chipotle is cutting its outlook — again
item.description: Chipotle pulls back on its expectations for the year for a third time in a row.

item.title: Meta stock slide erases $237 billion in market cap as Wall Street pans ‘runaway’ AI spending
item.description: Meta’s spending is hard to rationalize, some analysts say, as it’s uncertain whether heavy investments into the metaverse will generate compelling ret...

item.title: Future wars will be fought in space — and these stocks will profit from ‘Top Gun’ in orbit
item.description: Space is the next frontier for the U.S. and China to fight over. These defense stocks are already launching.

item.title: Why Alphabet’s stock looks like a better play than Meta’s in the AI race
item.description: Both companies are spending big on AI, but Google’s diversified business and cost discipline could help it pull ahead

item.title: Investors need to know Trump has a plan to strengthen America’s rare-earths miners
item.description: There’s a truce between the U.S. and China when it comes to rare-earths minerals, but America’s national security depends on its self-sufficiency.

item.title: Financial Services Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: Gain insight on Experian, SoFi Technologies and more in the latest Market Talks covering Financial Services.

item.title: Arabica Coffee Prices Hit Record on U.S., Colombia Tariff Spat

item.title: DeepSeek Won't Sink U.S. AI Titans
item.description: Panic fueling the selloff of Nvidia, Broadcom and other tech giants is overblown.

item.title: Stocks Sink in Broad AI Rout Sparked by China's DeepSeek
item.description: U.S. stocks were mostly lower, with the Nasdaq leading declines as makers of AI infrastructure suffered steep falls, many in the double digits. Nvidia...

item.title: Comex Gold, Silver Settle Lower
item.description: Gold settled 1.4% lower, down two of the past three sessions, and silver fell 2.5%, down three of the past four sessions.
